original_data.question: A 23-year-old woman, gravida 2, para 1, at 28 weeks' gestation comes to the physician for a routine prenatal examination. Her previous pregnancy was uncomplicated and she gave birth to a healthy boy. Her blood group is A, Rh-negative. The father's blood group is B, Rh-positive. Administration of which of the following is most appropriate at this time?

model_response:
The patient is Rh-negative and her fetus is Rh-positive. Therefore, there is a potential for Rh incompatibility and the development of Rh antibodies in the mother. Administration of anti-D IgG at 28 weeks' gestation decreases the risk of maternal sensitization. If the mother is exposed to fetal red blood cells at delivery or by trauma, administration of anti-D IgG within 72 hours will decrease the risk of a secondary immune response and prevent the development of antibodies. Anti-A IgG would be given if the mother was Rh-negative and A-positive. Anti-B IgG would be given if the mother was Rh-negative and B-positive. Anti-D IgM would be given if the mother was Rh-negative and D-positive.

###Answer: OPTION D IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Human females as cultural, psychological, sociological, political, and economic entities.
The number of offspring a female has borne. It is contrasted with GRAVIDITY, which refers to the number of pregnancies, regardless of outcome.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
The status during which female mammals carry their developing young (EMBRYOS or FETUSES) in utero before birth, beginning from FERTILIZATION to BIRTH.
The process of giving birth to one or more offspring.
A classification of blood based on the presence or absence of inherited antigenic substances on the surface of erythrocytes.

An absence finding of the specified component / analyte, organism or clinical sign based on the established threshold of the performed test or procedure.

\[Note: Negative does not necessarily imply the complete absence of the specified item.\]
A classification of blood based on the presence or absence of inherited antigenic substances on the surface of erythrocytes.
Deciduous maxillary right first molar tooth; Universal designation B; ISO designation 54
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
The dimension of the physical universe which, at a given place, orders the sequence of events. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 6th ed)
